name: ElasticComputeCloudSpotFleetSpotFleetRequestConfigDataLaunchSpecifications
description: LaunchSpecifications is a property of the Amazon EC2 SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData property that defines the launch specifications for the Spot fleet request.

properties.name: BlockDeviceMappings
properties.desc: Defines the block devices that are mapped to the Spot instances.
properties.type: List of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData LaunchSpecifications BlockDeviceMappings

properties.name: EbsOptimized
properties.desc: Indicates whether the instances are optimized for Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) I/O. This optimization provides dedicated throughput to Amazon EBS and an optimized configuration stack to provide optimal EBS I/O performance. This optimization isn't available with all instance types. Additional usage charges apply when you use an Amazon EBS-optimized instance.

properties.name: IamInstanceProfile
properties.desc: Defines the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) instance profile to associate with the instances.
properties.type: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData LaunchSpecifications IamInstanceProfile

properties.name: ImageId
properties.desc: The unique ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to launch on the instances.

properties.name: InstanceType
properties.desc: Specifies the instance type of the EC2 instances.

properties.name: KernelId
properties.desc: The ID of the kernel that is associated with the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) AMI.

properties.name: KeyName
properties.desc: An Amazon EC2 key pair to associate with the instances.

properties.name: Monitoring
properties.desc: Enable or disable monitoring for the instances.
properties.type: Amazon EC2 SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData LaunchSpecifications Monitoring

properties.name: NetworkInterfaces
properties.desc: The network interfaces to associate with the instances.
properties.type: List of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData LaunchSpecifications NetworkInterfaces

properties.name: Placement
properties.desc: Defines a placement group, which is a logical grouping of instances within a single Availability Zone (AZ).
properties.type: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData LaunchSpecifications Placement

properties.name: RamdiskId
properties.desc: The ID of the RAM disk to select. Some kernels require additional drivers at launch. Check the kernel requirements for information about whether you need to specify a RAM disk. To find kernel requirements, refer to the AWS Resource Center and search for the kernel ID.

properties.name: SecurityGroups
properties.desc: One or more security group IDs to associate with the instances.
properties.type: List of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud SpotFleet SpotFleetRequestConfigData LaunchSpecifications SecurityGroups

properties.name: SubnetId
properties.desc: The ID of the subnet in which to launch the instances.

properties.name: UserData
properties.desc: Base64-encoded MIME user data that instances use when starting up.

properties.name: WeightedCapacity
properties.desc: The number of units provided by the specified instance type. These units are the same units that you chose to set the target capacity in terms of instances or a performance characteristic, such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. For more information, see How Spot Fleet Works in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux Instances.
